    • Method Detail

      • matches

        public short matches(IField field)
        Description copied from interface: ITypeHandler
        Checks wether the given IField is matching the criteria in the current instance. The method returns a graded result, one of ITypeHandler.MATCH_NONE, ITypeHandler.MATCH_MINOR or ITypeHandler.MATCH_MAJOR
        Specified by:
        matches in interface ITypeHandler
        Parameters:
        field - the field to be checked
        Returns:
        MATCH_NONE if the field is not handled by the current instance, MATCH_MINOR if it is fitting partially ( like a subclass for instance ) or MATCH_MAJOR if it is highly fitting, like the exact class for instance

        matches in interface ITypeHandler
        Parameters:
        cls - the Class to be checked
        annotation - an annotation of type Referenced or Embedded or NULL. ITypeHandler can react to this information

      • matchesClass

        protected short matchesClass(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        Checks wether the given Class is handled by the current implementation
        Parameters:
        cls - the class to be checked
        Returns:
        MATCH_NONE if the field is not handled by the current instance, MATCH_MINOR if it is fitting partially ( like a subclass for instance ) or MATCH_MAJOR if it is highly fitting, like the exact class for instance

      • matchesAnnotation

        protected boolean matchesAnnotation(java.lang.annotation.Annotation annotation)
        Checks wether the given implementation handles the Annotation of type Referenced or Embedded or null
        Parameters:
        annotation - an Annotation of type Referenced, Embedded or null
        Returns:
        true, if the current implementation handles this. The default implementation returns true

      • getSubTypeHandler

        public ITypeHandler getSubTypeHandler(java.lang.Class<?> subClass,
                                      java.lang.annotation.Annotation embedRef)
        Description copied from interface: ITypeHandler
        Some ITypeHandler, which are processing List, Array, Map etc., are using sub handler to process the values of the List etc. Those handler must not come from out of the same ITypeHandlerFactory. For example can decide a CollectionHandler, that it serializes all children into JSon and thus is using the JSonTypeHandlerFactory to define the typehandlers
        Specified by:
        getSubTypeHandler in interface ITypeHandler
        Parameters:
        subClass - the class to be examined
        embedRef - an annotation of type Referenced or Embedded or NULL. ITypeHandler can react to this information
        Returns:
        a valid ITypeHandler
